definition:
Suppose $V_1,\ldots, V_N$ are vector spaces over a field
${\mathbbmss{F}}$. Then the Cartesian product
$V_1\times \cdots \times V_N$ is a vector space when addition and scalar
multiplication is defined as follows $$\begin{aligned}
   (u_1,\ldots, u_N) +    (v_1,\ldots, v_N) &=&    (u_1+v_1,\ldots, u_N+v_N), \\
   k (u_1,\ldots, u_N) &=& (k u_1,\ldots, k u_N)\end{aligned}$$ for
$u_i, v_i \in V_i$, $k\in {\mathbbmss{F}}$.

For example, the vector space structure of ${\mathbbmss{R}}^n$ if
defined as above.

### Properties {#properties .unnumbered}

1.  If $V_i$ are vector spaces and $W_i\subset V_i$ are subspaces, then
    $W_1\times \cdots \times W_N$ is a vector subspace of
    $V_1\times \cdots \times V_N$.

2.  The dimension of $V_1\times \cdots \times V_N$ is
    $\dim V_1+ \cdots +\dim V_N$.
